You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Configure External Sharing Settings for Storefront Users

To make sure that your buyers can successfully access your storefront's content, set up the appropriate sharing settings. These settings grant the minimum access necessary for certain B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects, which power your storefront's content and experience. These settings also ensure that access for a guest user is as restrictive as possible by default, which helps secure your storefront against unauthorized access.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) release build 3.149 or later
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) release build 3.147 or later
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) patch 3.145.9 or later
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) patch 3.142.20 or later
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) patch 3.136.36 or later
CloudCraze 4.8 patch 3.133.24 or later
CloudCraze 4.7 patch 3.124.36 or later


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To set default sharing access:	Manage Sharing
NOTE These steps help you resolve the security alert, Secure Guest Users' Org-Wide Defaults and Sharing Model. This security alert is automatically enabled with the Salesforce Summer ’20 release and becomes mandatory with the Salesforce Winter ’21 release.
From Setup, enter Sharing Settings in the Quick Find box, and then select Sharing Settings.
In the Organization-Wide Defaults section, click Edit.
Set the correct user visibility and guest user access settings.
Scroll to the User Visibility Settings section, and deselect Site User Visibility (1).
NOTE Deselecting this option ensures that your site users can't view information about other site users.
Scroll to the Other Settings section, and verify that Secure guest user record access (2) is enabled.
NOTE This setting ensures that a guest user's organization-wide default (OWD) external access for B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects is Private by default. Enabling this option is mandatory for complying with the security alert, Secure Guest Users' Org-Wide Defaults and Sharing Model. Enabling this setting also makes available the criteria type required for creating sharing rules for guest user access, which you complete in the next topic.

You can wait to save your changes—continue editing sharing settings in the next step.

Verify the OWD external access for the standard account object.
While editing the OWD settings, scroll to the Account and Contract object (1).
Check the value for Default External Access (2), and select Private if it isn't already selected.
IMPORTANT To ensure the security of external users' account information, we recommend that you set the OWD external access for the account object to Private. If this setting is anything other than Private, any logged-in user can view account information for accounts they don’t belong to.
You guessed it—you're not done with sharing settings yet. Wait to save, and continue to the next step.
Update the OWD external access for certain B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects.
NOTE A critical update in Salesforce Summer ’19 automatically sets the OWD external access for some B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects to Private. If you leave these settings unchanged, site and guest users can't access significant parts of your storefront, including products and categories.
While editing the OWD settings, scroll to the objects with a CC prefix, such as CC Account Group.
For each of the following objects, select Public Read Only for its Default External Access value, if it isn't already selected.
TIP With B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12), the managed package installation automatically sets OWD external access for these objects to Public Read Only. If you're using this version, no action is necessary, and you can skip to step 5.c.
CC Account Group	CC Page Section	CC Rich Content
CC Account Group Price List	CC Price List	CC Site Index
CC Attribute	CC Product	CC Spec
CC Category	CC Product Index	CC Subscriber Page
CC Composite Product	CC Promotion	CC Term
CC Contact Address	CC Public Cache	
CC Page Label	CC Related Product Group	
Depending on which features you plan to support on your storefront, update the Default External Access value for other relevant objects.
TIP
If you're using B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12), the managed package installation sets OWD external access for all these objects to Public Read Only. For any objects that you don't plan to use in your solution, manually set the OWD external access to Private.
If you're using any earlier version of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, manually set the OWD external access for the objects that you plan to use. For any objects that you don't plan to use, leave their OWD external access set to Private.
For coupons, the OWD external access value that you select for some objects depends on which version of B2B Commerce for Visualforce you've installed.
FEATURE	OBJECT	B2B COMMERCE FOR VISUALFORCE VERSION	DEFAULT EXTERNAL ACCESS VALUE
Coupons	CC Coupon	Winter ’21 (version 4.13)	Public Read Only
Spring ’20 (version 4.12) or earlier	Public Read/Write
CC Product	Winter ’21 (version 4.13)	Public Read Only
Spring ’20 (version 4.12) or earlier	Public Read/Write
CC Price Modifier	Any version	Public Read Only
CC Rule	Any version	Public Read Only
CC Rule Target SKU	Any version	Public Read Only
Contract pricing	CC Price Group	Any version	Public Read Only
Product inventory and availability	CC Product Inventory Item	Any version	Public Read Only
Sellers	CC Seller	Any version	Public Read Only
Shipping rate table	CC Shipping Rate	Any version	Public Read Only
Storefront associations	CC Storefront Association	Any version	Public Read Only
Tax rate table	CC Tax Rate	Any version	Public Read Only
Tiered pricing	CC Price Modifier	Any version	Public Read Only
CC Rule	Any version	Public Read Only
CC Rule Target SKU	Any version	Public Read Only
Click Save (finally).
